pr_title: DHFPROD-6121: Set the right target database in mapping step navigation

timeline.message: DHFPROD-6121: Set the right target database in mapping step navigation

timeline.bodyText: Is this always true? Or is it only true if targetDatabase is configured in the step options?
timeline.author: rjrudin

replies.bodyText: It's only true if targetDatabase is configured in step options.
replies.author: akshaysonvane

replies.bodyText: Can you add that to the assertion message? The current assertion message is restating what the assertEquals is communicating - that we expect the stepResponse to have the targetDatabase. The assertion message needs to explain why that is - in this case, the reason is that if the step options contain targetDatabase, then it's expected to be added to the stepResponse.
replies.author: rjrudin

timeline.bodyText: It's a bit difficult to look at this and be sure there's no error. I think some unit tests are needed for the withStep method - none exist yet. Those tests would verify that targetDatabase is set if it exists in the options for the given step, but not set if targetDatabase doesn't exist in the given step's options but does exist in another step's options.
timeline.author: rjrudin

timeline.bodyText: I don't see any test coverage for this. I think it would be reasonable to do unit tests against this method with a fake jobNode - i.e. no need to run a job first.
timeline.author: rjrudin

timeline.message: DHFPROD-6121: Set the right target database in mapping step navigation

timeline.bodyText: Because this test has no dependency on ML or Spring, don't extend this base class. Just instantiate a new JobsController. That makes it clear that the method being tested has no dependencies too (and the test runs a bit faster too).
timeline.author: rjrudin

replies.bodyText: The processTargetDatabase function in JobsController depends on Spring since it needs access to the HubClient for getting the database name.
replies.author: akshaysonvane
